item.title: Report I-2024100158
item.description:
Report I-2024100158

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-24
  • City: CLEVES
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CENTRAL RAILROAD CO OF INDIANA
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: At 1246 EST on Tuesday, September 24, 2024, a report was made to the Whitewater Township Fire Department of a railcar off-gassing with a spray paint-like odor. The reported railcar, PROX 24041, was documented to contain Styrene Monomer and was located at a railyard near Cleves, OH (39.171181° , -84.763446°). The railcar was staged in the Central Railroad of Indiana Cleves Yard. The Whitewater Township Fire Department arrived on site around 1314 to begin cooling efforts. CTEH, SPSI, GHD, HEPACO, Enviro-Serve, and EnviroScience were mobilized to' perform emergency response services. On 9/26/2024 at 1927 EST the evacuation order for Whitewater Township was lifted. 5x(5+1+0)x(5+4) = NARRI 270

item.title: Report E-2024110409
item.description:
Report E-2024110409

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-22T12:30:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-13
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 13, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN1824 was cracked and released approximately one (1) gallon of product tot he trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew patched the damaged tote and deployed granular absorbents to remediate the sodium hydroxide-impacted trailer floor. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) lined 15-gallon drum and staged onsite.

item.title: Report E-2024110401
item.description:
Report E-2024110401

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-22T12:30:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-11
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 11, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3098 was damaged in transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew deployed granular absorbents and utilized hand tools to work them in. All impacted materials and damaged cargo were collected and containerized into two (2) 35-gallon drums then staged onsite for further management.

item.title: Report E-2024110447
item.description:
Report E-2024110447

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-22T12:30:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-07
  • City: HEBRON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When driver went out to perform his pre trip at the beginning of the day he noticed liquid had dripped onto the drive tire and the pavement at 0530et. The driver put down some absorbent and then called to have a team dispatched to provide the clean up. The crew showed up around 0800et and dawned the proper PPE and made entry into the trailer. They found that a 55 gallon drum had sever rust that had damaged the integrity allowing the material to seep out. The team then removed the container and placed it into a salvage drum and then cleaned up the material that was on the floor of the trailer and that had gotten on the pavement. The absorbents were disposed of in the proper manner. The release was less than 1 gallon and the crew was complete by 1100et.

item.title: Report E-2024110345
item.description:
Report E-2024110345

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-11
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ON November 11, 2024, four (4) 5-gallon pails of paint were crushed and released approximately three (3) gallons of paint to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the paint impacted site. All impacted materials and the damaged pails were collected and containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110332
item.description:
Report E-2024110332

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-04
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately three (3) gallons of product released from one (1) fifty-five (55) gallon poly drum due to a forklift puncture. Personnel advised the release impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel stated that the material was cleaned up using Oil Dri absorbent. Personnel completed cleanup and generated one (1) sixty-five (65) gallon poly drum along with the damaged 55-gallon DM of product. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
